body: On Thursday, the fourth day after the blizzard that inundated New York, Mayor Michael R. Bloomberg toured the city and took his lumps. The mayor visited the four boroughs beyond Manhattan, delivering the message that every street had been plowed and every stranded car and bus would soon be pulled or pushed out of the mire. But this was hardly a
title: Bloomberg Is Criticized on Storm Response as He Tours the City Beyond Manhattan

body: Last week, news emerged of the Bloomberg administration's proposal to extend the No. 7 subway train under the Hudson River to Secaucus, N.J. The idea has become an intriguing Plan B after Gov. Chris Christie of New Jersey halted a new commuter rail to Midtown Manhattan because of rising costs. The latest proposal would extend the New York City
title: READER COMMENTS; Extend the 7? Bring It On

body: POOLE--Dorothy Ruth. On October 19, 2010. Employee of Time Life Magazine for over 25 years. Beloved sister of Helen A. Magee. Cherished aunt of many nieces and nephews. Funeral Mass Saturday 9:30am, Resurrection R.C. Church. Service to follow at the Greenwood Crematory. Funeral services entrusted to the Marine Park Funeral Home, 3024 Quentin Road,
title: Paid Notice: Deaths POOLE, DOROTHY RUTH

body: FLAHERTY--Joseph Brian, on September 5, 2010. WWII Army Veteran and Retired Court Clerk for the New York State Court System. Beloved son of the late Michael and Julia (nee Neary). Loving brother of Alfred B. and the late Mary. Cherished cousin of many. Funeral Saturday 8:30am from the Marine Park Funeral Home, 3024 Quentin Rd., Brooklyn. Funeral
title: Paid Notice: Deaths FLAHERTY, JOSEPH BRIAN

body: FOR New Yorkers who don't make it out to the far western edge of Coney Island too often, Sea Gate might be more familiar as the skinny thumb of land that appears below window seats during some takeoffs from Kennedy International Airport. But getting into the neighborhood by land is another story. True to its name, Sea Gate is a gated community,
title: LIVING IN | SEA GATE, BROOKLYN; The Beach Is Never Far Away

author: E-mail: habitats@nytimes.com
body: DECADES before Carrie Bradshaw settled into her apartment in an East Side brownstone, the neighborhood was a mecca for young single women seeking a taste of the big city. And among the legions drawn to the area was a 21-year-old design school graduatenamed Robbin Brosterman, who in 1980 moved to a one-bedroom apartment on East 57th Street. ''A
title: HABITATS | LENOX HILL; The Studio, Act II: Enter Husband

body: AROUND TOWN New York City ANNUAL ALL-NIGHT WALKING TOUR OF REVOLUTIONARY WAR NEW YORK, Lower Manhattan. Led by James Kaplan. It meets Sunday at 2 a.m. at Broadway and Murray Street and ends at 6 a.m. in front of Fraunces Tavern Museum, 54 Pearl Street, the sponsor of the walk. Fee: $20, members $15; (212) 471-8546 or (212) 425-1778. EATING CONTESTS
title: Spare Times

author: Dvora Meyers, a freelance writer and Hebrew teacher, lives in Clinton Hill, she writes about Judaism and gymnastics on her blog, at unorthodoxgymnastics.com; Ellen Levitt lives in Midwood and teaches social studies at a Brooklyn High school.
body: This week's Complaint Box features two views on one borough's identity crisis, from Dvora Meyers and Ellen Levitt. I'm From Brooklyn, She Said in Her Southern Drawl As a 27-year-old single woman living in Brooklyn, I enjoy the communal events that warm weather brings: summer concerts in Prospect Park, street fairs, outdoor dining with friends. But
title: CITY ROOM; Complaint Box | Borough Pride; I'm From Brooklyn, She Said in Her Southern Drawl

body: CENTENNIAL BEE-DAY PARTY In Kafka's ''Metamorphosis'' Gregor Samsa awakens to discover that he has become an enormous cockroach. While that may be among the most unwelcome transformations on record, the Brooklyn Botanic Garden will offer one on Saturday that's shorter, sweeter and sunnier: children changing themselves into bees. The process is part
title: Spare Times: For Children

body: IT was an unseasonably hot Saturday in April, and the three dozen terrariums on display in a booth at the Brooklyn Flea were sweating, the moisture turning into beads on their glass containers. Katy Maslow and Michelle Inciarrano, who were selling the miniature gardens, answered questions from passers-by. An antique magnifying glass sat nearby, for
title: Garden in a Bottle

body: Brooklyn is one of the most Democratic counties in the country. The nearly 900,000 enrolled Democrats in the borough outnumber Republicans by about eight to one. More Brooklynites left the party affiliation line on their latest Board of Elections enrollment forms blank than the 112,000 who described themselves as Republicans. Of all the members of
title: MILL BASIN JOURNAL; Brooklyn's G.O.P. Is Old Enough, but Quite a Few Members Shy of Grand

author: Karen Zraick contributed reporting.
body: A burglary suspect apparently shot and killed himself on Monday night after fleeing police officers who exchanged fire with him outside a house in Brooklyn, the police said. The confrontation occurred in the Marine Park neighborhood, the police said, after a neighbor called the police about 6:20 p.m. to report a burglary at 3701 Quentin Road, at
title: Burglary Suspect Dies, Apparently at His Own Hand

body: FOR more than three decades, Kurt Seidl worked as a chef, cook, bartender and, most recently, nanny. He wrote in his spare time, self-publishing collections of short stories under the name Gerald Conteh. But Mr. Seidl was not only writing under a pen name; it turns out he was also living under one. In 1975, Mr. Seidl was arrested on federal charges
title: Hiding in Plain Sight As Chef, Nanny, Author

author: E-mail: dwyer@nytimes.com
body: Trapped in closets all over New York, and probably the world, are ghosts from thousands of prom nights, Sweet 16 parties, weddings. The fancy dress: usually worn once for a few hours, then retired from active duty. ''I love them; then I never wanted to wear it again,'' Megan Kerrigan, 30, said. ''It'll hang in my closet, and I don't want to throw
title: ABOUT NEW YORK; From Deep in the Closet To a Needy Girl's Prom
